Technical Skills
Technical Skill Areas
Real Estate Development: Project design, entitlement processes, construction management, and lease-up strategies
Patent Development: Concept design, technical drafting, USPTO submission, and collaboration with patent counsel
CAD and Modeling Tools: Proficient with SketchUp, Patent Sketches, and custom diagramming
Software & Programming: Python (scripts, Flask web apps), HTML/CSS, database queries (MySQL/MariaDB)
Building Systems: Component Database and Unit Pricing Aggregation, and energy system optimization
Analysis (Conceptual): Finite element Analysis, deflection, financial calculations
Professional Philosophy
Approach and Principles
Michael Hoffman believes the best results come from clear thinking, honest communication, and deep interdisciplinary collaboration. His working style emphasizes:

Systems Thinking: Looking across disciplines to find points of leverage—technical, financial, or organizational
Practical Innovation: Adapting existing tools in new ways before inventing something entirely new
Team Assembly: Prioritizing competence and integrity over credentials or formal hierarchy
Client and Community Alignment: Working only on projects that meet a real need and have long-term benefit
Grounded Execution: Balancing idealism with realistic implementation plans
Michael sees housing not just as shelter, but as infrastructure for human potential. His work combines quiet technical competence with a mission-driven ethic.

Additional Accomplishments
Creative & Educational Projects
In addition to his technical and development work, Michael Hoffman has authored a children's book and contributed to educational initiatives aimed at family-centered literacy and bonding.

Cooking Love (2023) – An ABC book for children that blends literacy and cooking.
